page.title: 15Gravel Battle, Bridgham
page.content:
There was almost total support for Bridgham Parish Council's fight against the gravel extraction planning application (see page 13). A strong campaign of objection was mounted in the local press and the issue also featured in two Radio Norfolk programmes. District and County Planning Committee members, regional environmental groups, etc. were all lobbied for their support.
The extraction proposal was strongly rejected by Breckland Planning Committee on l3th May l985; less than a week later Atlas Aggregates withdrew their application, foreseeing a similar defeat at County level.
But what of the future? We know this was only the first battle in a long campaign.
